{"step_by_step_thinking": "When a distal root of a mandibular third molar is missing during extraction, it is important to consider the possible locations where the root tip may be. The submental space is located beneath the chin and is unlikely to be the location of the missing root tip. The submandibular space is located beneath the mandible and is a potential location for the root tip. The para pharyngeal space is located behind the pharynx and is also a potential location. The pterygomandibular space is located between the medial pterygoid muscle and the mandible and is less likely to be the location of the missing root tip. Therefore, the most likely location for the missing distal root tip of the mandibular third molar is either the submandibular space or the para pharyngeal space.", "answer_choice": "B. Submandibular space or C. Para pharyngeal space"}
